page.title: 12INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: PLANNING BEGAN IN 1959 AND THE LIBRARY WAS BUILT IN 1970. THERE ARE 9200 BOOKS: ADULT, JUNIOR AND REFERENCE. LARGE PRINT BOOKS ARE AVAILABLE. TAPES AND RECORDS MAY BE BORROWED. THE LIBRARY IS CLOSED ON WEDNESDAY. THE VILLAGE DIARY IS ON DISPLAY AND CAN BE ADDED TO BY ANY CLUB OR ORGANISATION. THERE IS A PHOTOCOPIER FOR HIRE. HOLIDAY ACTIVITIES FOR CHILDREN ARE ORGANISED. IN 1985 A SCHEME CALLED "READ AROUND THE TOWN" WAS USED TO PROMOTE READING FOR CHILDREN 7+ TO 12+. IN 6 WEEKS, 6 BOOKS HAD TO BE READ,AND THE STORIES RETOLD TO ONE OF THE STAFF. AN EXTENSION TO INCREASE THE HOLDING TO 16000 BOOKS BEGAN IN 1985 AND THERE WILL BE A COMPUTER LINK TO THE LIBRARY SERVICE AT CHICHESTER.
